fields.Book Title: F.D.E. Schleiermacher’s Outlines of the Art of Education A Translation & Discussion
fields.Description/Abstract: Schleiermacher is of the conviction—however unusual it sounds today—that education<br>is not a matter primarily for logical analysis, normative judgment or even for empirical<br>investigation. Education as a discipline, according to Schleiermacher, does not answer<br>primarily to rules of logic, to fixed norms and values, or to matters of empirical fact.<br>Education, in other words, is adequately addressed neither through normativizing critical<br>analysis, nor through empirical investigation and assessment— arguably the two<br>dominant discourses in educational research today. Education for Schleiermacher, as<br>Schmied- Kowarzik (2008) writes, “is neither a normative nor an empirical discipline,<br>but is instead a practical one which is concerned with the uncovering of dialectical interconnections…”<br>(p. 61; emphases added). Schleiermacher himself puts it thusly: “Our<br>observations here are not speculative but are in the strict sense of the word theoretical.”<br>And the “strict sense” of theory— captured in the ancient Greek theoria3— “relate[s] ”<br>above all “to a specific practice,” as Schleiermacher himself goes on to explain (above,<br>p. 29; emphases added).
